intro: Onosmodium strigosum, commonly known as the hairy onosmodium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
